thoughts.text: The 'read_file' command is returning an error. We can try using the 'execute_shell' command to read the contents of the file instead.
thoughts.reasoning: If the 'read_file' command is returning an error, it is possible that there is an issue with the command itself or that we are not using it correctly. By using the 'execute_shell' command to read the contents of the file instead, we can see if there is an issue with the command itself or if it is related to the file we were trying to read earlier.
thoughts.plan: - Use the 'execute_shell' command with the argument 'cat /usr/bin/python3' to read the contents of the /usr/bin/python3 file
thoughts.criticism: I should make sure to select a file that we have permission to read and that is not critical to the system.
thoughts.speak: The 'read_file' command is returning an error. We can try using the 'execute_shell' command to read the contents of the file instead.
